# Convert "ts-boxable" objects to xts format (extension of `tsbox::ts_xts()`)

Convert "ts-boxable" objects to xts format (extension of
[`tsbox::ts_xts()`](https://docs.ropensci.org/tsbox/reference/ts_ts.html))

## Usage

``` r
conv_xts(x)
```

## Arguments

- x:

  a "ts-boxable" object to be converted

## Value

returns an object in xts format.

## Details

This function performs a similar operation to
[`tsbox::ts_xts()`](https://docs.ropensci.org/tsbox/reference/ts_ts.html).
It converts ts-boxable objects to the xts format. An important
difference compared with
[`tsbox::ts_xts()`](https://docs.ropensci.org/tsbox/reference/ts_ts.html)
is that the x argument of `conv_xts()` can be a wide tbl.

## Examples

``` r
quarterly_data_example |>
  conv_tslist() |>
  conv_xts()
#>             E_NF_HI   ECT_HI   EMN_HI   EWT_HI   ERT_HI E_TRADE_HI  E_TU_HI
#> 1998-01-01 530.5066 23.26007 15.89295 15.86667 65.16667   81.02675 27.89353
#> 1998-04-01 531.2062 22.99386 15.75995 15.93333 64.63333   80.56048 27.86049
#> 1998-07-01 532.6954 23.00466 15.80416 15.90000 64.23333   80.13792 27.60437
#> 1998-10-01 531.4825 23.05090 15.78369 16.00000 64.20000   80.21748 27.31709

quarterly_data_example |>
  conv_wide() |>
  conv_xts()

#> 2024-10-01     51.06667 19.20000
#> 2025-01-01     51.83333 19.30000
quarterly_data_example |>
  tsbox::ts_long() |>
  tsbox::ts_pick("E_NF_HI") |>
  conv_wide() |>
  conv_xts()
#>             E_NF_HI
#> 1998-01-01 530.5066
#> 1998-04-01 531.2062
#> 1998-07-01 532.6954

#> 2000-01-01 544.4418

#>        ...

#> 2023-07-01 632.2179
#> 2023-10-01 631.8120

#> 2024-04-01 636.4715
```
